name: Alimama
description:
Welcome to Alimama Tea, where we blend the flavors of yesterday with today's best natural ingredients, guided by clean minds, calm hearts, and compassionate spirits.
From our mochi desserts to our cold brew teas, we handcraft all of our products with passion and purpose, to nourish your health with zero compromises on taste. Whether you are looking for something to cultivate your vegan sensibilities, sustain a gluten-free diet, or soothe that sweet tooth, you will find it here.

name: Ample Hills Creamery
description: It's knowing our goal is just to create something that will make people happy—pure and simple. Ample Hills is dedicated to making the world a happier place, and that doesn't stop at ice cream. We have made a habit of partnering with charities fiercely fighting for a better, safer world.

name: Bar Pa Tea
address: 85 Kenmare Street store #2, New York, NY 10012
description: At Bar Pa Tea, we strive to create a more healthful alternative to the original beverage without compromising the distinct taste and experience of traditional bubble tea.

name: Cha Cha Matcha
description: Cause we promise to keep it fresh, just like the cities we call home. Lastly, we promise to serve you only the finest—in store and online. We're proud as hell to serve some of the best matcha on the planet, in the most delicious ways we can think up.

name: ChikaLicious Dessert Bar
description: Est. 2003, ChikaLicious Dessert Bar features fresh, fun and innovative individual desserts, as served in NYC’s top restaurants. This intimate, 20-seat eatery is built around an open kitchen where the chefs and sommelier work and serve customers directly. If you are passionate about food, here is your chance to enjoy fabulous desserts while watching both their preparation and plating.

name: Dominique Ansel Bakery
description: This bakery-cafe headed by pastry chef Dominique Ansel serves up creative & beautiful French treats.

name: Minus 10 Ice Cream
description: Nestled on Mott Street, in the heart of historic New York Chinatown, we invite you to experience ice cream like no other. Nothing tastes better than fresh homemade ice cream that comes right out of the ice cream maker. At Minus10 Ice Cream, we strive to achieve the same feeling with each customer, turning liquid cream to ice cream in under two minutes. Using an advanced cold plate that reaches temperatures well below -10°F, the ice cream produces smaller ice molecules to make it naturally smoother and creamier, eliminating the need to add in additional fat and emulsifiers to create the same rich, creamy texture we love in ice cream.

name: Eggloo
description:
Eggloo is a novelty dessert shop located in the heart of New York City. We aim to reinvent your dessert experience by bringing a popular Hong Kong street food to the streets of New York City. Through unconventional flavors and unique combinations, we bring to you the Eggloo Creations! 
Our desserts — the Eggloo Creations combine authentic traditional Hong Kong egg waffles with your favorite flavors of ice cream! The texture of the waffles - crispy on the outside, and sweet and soft on the inside pairs perfectly with our creamy and refreshing ice cream.

name: Eileen's Special Cheesecake
description: “You can’t talk about new york city style cheesecake without mentioning Eileen’s.”

name: Five Pennies Creamery
address: 11 N Park Ave, Rockville Centre, NY 11570
description:
Five Pennies Creamery is the brainchild of Dan Levine.  As a native New Yorker and Brooklynite for over 40 years, Dan set out to create a mom and pop shop that reflected a classic, and sometimes forgotten, New York.
Named after the timeless film, The Five Pennies, which chronicles the life of jazz singer Red Nichols, & tells the story of a man who values love over career ambition-- our ice cream is just that.  We're low in pretension & corporate gimmicks, but high in quality & rich in love.

name: Flour shop
description: Flour Shop’s baker and Flour-ist, Amirah Kassem, is an artist at heart and cake is her medium. But she didn’t learn her skills in culinary school. Instead, Amirah grew up baking and sculpting with her mother in Mexico, where she discovered an appreciation for fine ingredients—and mastered the art of multi-sensory experiences. Today, her food-based installations have been exhibited everywhere from private settings at the Whitney Museum to 64-foot edible hallways at the Brooklyn Museum; while her fondant-free creations have also caught the attention of Vogue, Harper’s BAZAAR, and every fashion party in NYC.

name: Gelso & Grand
address:
186 Grand Street, NY, NY 10013
Little Italy NYC
description: Housemade pasta & other Italian standards served in spacious, stylish rustic surrounds with a bar.

name: Jacques Torres Icecream
description: As Jacques’ second Grand Central location, a new menu of savory treats has been added. From sorbets to crepes to tartine sandwiches, the Jacques Torres Chocolate Ice Cream location is taking things one step further.

name: Kay's Boutique Toast
description: Bangkok-based cafe offering coffee, matcha lattes & dessertlike French toast sticks.

name: Levain Bakery
description: It all began with two great friends and a simple mission: create the world’s best chocolate chip cookie. 25 years later, the rest is history, baked fresh daily. Sharing something truly delicious can change your day. And day by day, it can change the world. World Peace, one cookie at time.

name: Magnolia Bakery
address:
401 Bleecker Street and W. 11th Street
New York, NY 200 Columbus Avenue at 69th Street
New York, NY
description: In 1996, Magnolia Bakery opened its first location on a quiet street corner in the heart of New York City’s West Village. From its inception, Magnolia Bakery has been cherished for its classic American baked goods, vintage decor and warm, inviting atmosphere.

name: Maman Bakery
address:
soho - 239 centre st, nyc
marché maman - 237 centre st, nyc 
tribeca -  211 west broadway, nyc
description: open seven days a week, maman offers a selection of delicious baked goods, coffee, fresh breakfast and lunch options, and seated lunch, brunch, and a full bar at selected locations. we serve a broad menu of hearty farm fresh salads, quiches, sandwiches, and of course pastries and sweets - you can’t leave without trying our famous nutty chocolate chip cookie, named one of ‘oprah’s favorite things’ for 2017 and and one of the best chocolate chip cookies in new york from ny magazine.

name: Matcha n More
description: Our goal is to bring a healthy yet delicious beverage to our local neighborhoods. Our matcha is imported personally from Uji, Japan where matcha was first introduced. All our puree and syrups are made in house with no artificial flavoring or food coloring. The ingredients are bought fresh and organic from reliable sources. We aim to bring awareness of this super food to the neighborhood, offering an alternative option of healthier and cleaner beverage that will satisfy your thirst.

name: Mochii
description: Every delicate light sweet are all individually handcrafted with quality ingredients. A batch of mochii can take up to 9 hours to make, all wrapped in a sticky rice dough with a variety of fillings. As we recommend having this treat enjoyed with your hands, getting messy is just part of the fun. As sugary treats are now on the rise, we hope that our bite-size dessert can be a sustainable way to enjoy sweets without feeling guilty.

name: Odd Fellows
address:
55 East Houston Street
New York, NY 10012 & 75 East 4th Street
New York, NY 10003
description: To create the highest quality and freshest product available, we pasteurize our own ice cream base -- using locally-sourced, hormone-free and additive-free dairy -- in our Brooklyn kitchen. While more time consuming, pasteurizing on location allows us to add more nuance and depth into our ice cream flavors. The result? Distinctive, creamy, and scrumptious flavors ranging from inventive renditions of the classics to the delectably unconventional.

name: PopBar
description: Gelato, sorbet & yogurt popsicles made daily with choice of toppings in a tiny space with few seats.

name: Project Brunch
description: “We built this restaurant on family recipes and values. It is our goal to provide exceptional quality food & service. To awaken the spirit, your secret chef, & love for all things brunch, in all mankind.”

name: Ray's Candy Store
description: NYC Institution Since 1974. Serving up the city's BEST fries, shakes, soft serve, hot dogs, egg creams, deep fried Oreos, and more! Open 24 hours a day!

name: Soft Swerve
description: Bright, urban shop doling out soft-serve ice cream & toppings in surprising, Asian-inspired flavors.

name: Stax IceCream
description: All our ice cream flavors are inspired by desserts in our founders' Asian American culture - subtly sweet but delicious, and will satisfy any sweet tooth craving. Our most popular dessert, the Cremella hot-pressed donut ice cream sandwich, allow customers to customize their preferred level of sweetness as we offer plain, vanilla glazed, and chocolate frosted donuts.

name: Sweet Moment
description: Located in the heart of NYC's Little Italy and Soho, Sweet Moment NYC has finally opened bringing the sweetest moments to everyone. We are known for our mountain high Bingsoos (Shaved Ice) with many different flavors, cute and tasty Bottle Cakes, in-house made Pastries and Cookies made by our own pâtissier and amazing coffee using La Colombe with - can't take my eyes off - kind of latte arts. We proudly represent the best Baristas in the city with amazing latte art skills.

name: Taiyaki Nyc
description: At Taiyaki NYC, we work hard as a family to focus on quality and consistency in the products we provide to our community. Our ice cream and taiyaki waffles are made from the highest quality ingredients from socially responsible vendors and distributors. Our taiyaki waffles are made fresh on-site, and our soft serve ice cream is produced and churned in small batches to preserve the true integrity of how a real soft serve should taste. We strive to keep our customers happy and satisfied while leaving a minimal footprint on our planet.

name: The Little One
description: Petite pastry shop serving Japanese teas & tiny, thoughtfully crafted sweets.

name: The Original Chinatown Ice Cream Factory
description: The origins of ice cream are both mythical and abstract, including legends attributing the invention of ice cream to the Chinese during the Tang Dynasty. Despite its unclear beginnings, the Chinatown Ice Cream Factory (CICF) has made ice cream a tangible and an undeniably delicious reality! CICF has been creating delicious ice cream for almost 4 decades and is often referred to as an "unofficial NYC landmark".  CICF continues its tradition of being a family run operation; now with a second generation. What’s the secret to our delectable frozen products?

name: Van Leeuwan
description: We started Van Leeuwen Ice Cream in the Spring of 2008 out of a buttery yellow truck on the streets of NYC. We set out to revive the classic American ice cream truck and the art of traditional ice cream using ingredients perfected by nature, not science. Van Leeuwen Classic and Vegan ice creams are made with just a handful of fresh ingredients. Each flavor is a celebration of some of the world’s best artisan producers and farmers both local and from around the world.

name: Wowfulls
address: 309 E Houston St, New York, NY 10002
description: Wowfulls was created by three average guys with a sweet tooth and an idea for sharing what they liked eating as kids. We began selling these amazing waffles with ice cream at Smorgasburg in 2015. Little did we know, we became a hit and started to trend on social media and everywhere else. We took this opportunity and magnified it. Since then, we have opened our first store in Lower East Side, expanded into catering and party our way into music festivals.We didn’t want to stop there. We started to come up with flavors of egg waffles that we’d like to eat. We whipped up flavors that we all love such as chocolate, coconut, red velvet, matcha and more! We pair our delicious waffles with ice cream and fun toppings to create what we call Wowfulls! It is WOW-full of flavor, color, fun and happiness.
